_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.   The Exel,Inc. facility located at 5522 Little Richmond in Dayton, Ohio was built
     for Hormel Foods as a refrigerated distribution center utilizing Anhydrous Ammonia.
2.   The refrigeration system is run by an Allen-Bradley SLC-5 programmable logic controller
     accessed by either an Allen-Bradley Panelview screen on the refrigeration control cabinet
     or through a personal computer utilizing Wonderware software.  The system can also be
     run manually through a series of Hand-Off-Auto switches located inside the refrigeration
     control cabinet or through manual manipulation of the automatic control valves.
3.   The operating temperature of the system will be +38 to -22 degrees Fahrenheit depending
     upon the area.
4.   The mechanical integrity of the system is maintained by a combination of routine inspections
     conducted by refrigeration and maintenance contractors, and routine maintenance conducted to 
     industry and manufacturer standards and coordinated through use of the Faciliworks Maintenance
     Manager program.
5.   We are improving safety at the facility through more effective training for system operators 
     and maintenance technicians which conforms to the recommendations of the Refrigerating 
     Engineers and Technicians Association (RETA)as well as the International Institute of Ammonia 
     Refrigeration (IIAR). This will include increased use of formal industrial refrigeration 
     training facilities such as those offered by Garden City Community College of Garden City,
     Kansas and Lanier Technical College of Oakwood, GA.
6.   There has not been an accidental release of Anhydrous Ammonia at this facility in the past 
     five years.
